reviewText: This concert took place in Salem, Virginia in October of 2002. I first heard the Statler Brothers on my car radio in the early 1970s while driving through WV on my way home to visit my mother. I believe they were singing "Moments To Remember". I stopped the car, wrote down the group's name and put that name on my forever watch and listen list. The harmony wasn't just in their voices. It seemed to be coming from one source. Harmony, emotion and meaning from four individuals in perfect sync. I think they were reading the American mind.

reviewText: The Statler Brothers are one of my favorites and it was both wonderful and sad to watch this video - sad because they won't be on stage again - but wonderful in DVD so yiou can watch them as many times as you want.

reviewText: I just received 2 dvd concerts of the Statlers. The other one is good, but this, Farewell Concert, is absolutely wonderful. For anyone who is a Statler fan, this is one concert I guarantee you will love. There are several songs here, one a cover, that just give me chills.

reviewText: I saw this concert on PBS and I now know that I didn't see the entire concert. PBS edited out about thirty minutes of it, the DVD was far better than PBS. I have always liked the Statler Brothers and they have never been a disappointment to watch. It is sad that they have now retired but they like the rest of us they can't go on forever but they have left us with a great final show in this DVD. Buy it you want be disappointed it is by far one of their best shows ever. Way to go guys, you'll always be the best quartet around and you will be missed.

reviewText: The DVD, which was recorded in Salem, Virginia, is the good-bye to touring performance by the legendary Statler Brothers.  If you like the Statlers, this is a must buy.  If you don't, consider the purchase, for it gives a very good introduction to the group, which is one of the most decorated in country music history, and may well be the best four part harmony group in recording history.All-in-all, a great presentation from four great American entertainers.Highest rating possible from me.
